00135 void discrimAnalysis
00136 (
00137         Array2D< double >& betweenCovarA,
00138         Array2D< double >& withinCovarA,
00139         Array2D< double >& transMatA,
00140         Array  < double >& dvecA,
00141         unsigned& m
00142 )
00143 {
00144     unsigned i, j, k;
00145 
00146     // Calculate transformation matrix for standard normal distribution:
00147     rankDecomp( withinCovarA, transMatA, dvecA );
00148 
00149     // Covariance matrix is symmetric, so only the lower triangle
00150     // matrix must contain values. Here the whole matrix is filled
00151     // with values by mirroring the given values:
00152     for( i = 0; i + 1 < betweenCovarA.dim( 0 ); ++i )
00153         {
00154         for( j = i + 1; j < betweenCovarA.dim( 0 ); ++j )
00155                 {
00156             betweenCovarA( i, j ) = betweenCovarA( j, i );
00157                 }
00158         }
00159 
00160     for( i = 0; i < betweenCovarA.dim( 0 ); ++i )
00161         {
00162         for( j = 0; j < betweenCovarA.dim( 0 ); ++j )
00163         {
00164             double t = 0.;
00165 
00166             for( k = 0; k < betweenCovarA.dim( 0 ); ++k )
00167                         {
00168                 t += transMatA( k, i ) * betweenCovarA( k, j );
00169                         }
00170 
00171             withinCovarA( i, j ) = t;
00172         }
00173         }
00174 
00175     for( i = 0; i < betweenCovarA.dim( 0 ); ++i )
00176         {
00177         for( j = 0; j <= i; ++j )
00178         {
00179             double t = 0.;
00180 
00181             for( k = 0; k < betweenCovarA.dim( 0 ); ++k )
00182                         {
00183                 t += withinCovarA( i, k ) * transMatA( k, j );
00184                         }
00185 
00186             betweenCovarA( i, j ) = t;
00187         }
00188         }
00189 
00190     // Dimension reduction by KLT on the mean values of the classes:
00191     //eigensymm( betweenCovarA, withinCovarA, dvecA );
00192     eigensymm_obsolete( betweenCovarA, withinCovarA, dvecA );
00193 
00194      // Calculate numerical rank, "m" is eventually reduced.
00195      //
00196      // this is not used any more, because the dimension reduction
00197      // can lead to worse results, if the rank is previously known
00198      // exactly (and this applies here).
00199      /*
00200          k = rank( b, w, d, n );
00201          if( k < *m ) *m = k;
00202      */
00203 
00204     for( i = 0; i < betweenCovarA.dim( 0 ); ++i )
00205         {
00206         for( j = 0; j < m; ++j )
00207         {
00208             double t = 0.;
00209 
00210             for( k = 0; k < betweenCovarA.dim( 0 ); k++ )
00211                         {
00212                 t += transMatA( i, k ) * withinCovarA( k, j );
00213                         }
00214 
00215             betweenCovarA( j, i ) = t;
00216         }
00217         }
00218 
00219     for( i = 0; i < m; i++ )
00220         {
00221         for( j = 0; j < betweenCovarA.dim( 0 ); ++j )
00222                 {
00223             transMatA( i, j ) = betweenCovarA( i, j );
00224                 }
00225         }
00226 }
